intro: Hieracium cacuminum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branching. Hieracium cacuminum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments.
